other_tests.findings: Rim enhancing fluid collection in the right lower quadrant of the abdomen, minimally enlarged, from 2.4 x 1.7 x 1.8 cm to 2.9 x 1.7 x 2.0 cm. Focal mucosal hyperemia, wall thickening, and fat stranding of a segment of distal descending colon, consistent with acute uncomplicated diverticulitis. No intra- or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. Small volume of ascites tracking to the pelvis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The rim enhancing fluid collection was minimally enlarged. There was focal mucosal hyperemia, wall thickening, and fat stranding consistent with diverticulitis compared to the prior study.
